intro: Brassica oleracea var. ardeina, commonly known as the Romanesco broccoli, is a cultivar of the cabbage family characterized by its distinctive spiral pattern and vibrant green color. It is a biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 40–60 cm, with thick, fleshy stems and tightly packed, cone-shaped flower clusters. The plant thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its edible parts include the young flower buds, which are harvested before they fully open. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and unique appearance, making it a popular choice in gourmet and specialty markets.
